channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Retirees facing financial strain as credit-card debt spikes
item.description: More retirees are carrying credit card balances theyâ€™ll struggle to pay off.

item.title: Intel and Commerce Department close to finalizing roughly $8 billion CHIPS Act grant, source says
item.description: The struggling chipmaker has cut jobs and pared back expansion plans as it grapples with its worst downturn ever, making the CHIPS Act money a welcome boost.

item.title: What Trump's pick for Treasury secretary could mean for global markets
item.description: Strategists regard hedge fund manager Scott Bessent, founder of Connecticut-based investment firm Key Square Group, as a "safe pair of hands."

item.title: U.S. government bonds stage biggest rally in nearly four months after Bessent picked for Treasury
item.description: Yields on the 10-year Treasury are poised for their biggest daily drop in about four months on hopes that President-elect Donald Trumpâ€™s pick of Scott Bessent to be Treasury secretary will help lower budget deficits

item.title: U.S. stock and bond markets love Trump's pick of Bessent for Treasury â€” here's why
item.description: Trump said he will pick the Wall Street figure to take on his administration's most important economic role.

item.title: How tech bros bought 'America's most pro-crypto Congress ever'
item.description: Crypto showed up in force this election cycle, raising tens of millions to vote out the industry's critics and vote in its friends.

item.title: Quikrete bulks up even more ahead of potential construction boom by buying Summit Materials
item.description: With interest rates coming down, the largest concrete company is buying Summit at a deal value of $11.5 billion including debt.

item.title: What Trump's pick for Treasury secretary could mean for global markets
item.description: Strategists regard hedge fund manager Scott Bessent, founder of Connecticut-based investment firm Key Square Group, as a "safe pair of hands."

item.title: Russian food prices are soaring â€” but no one dares blame Putin and the war
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has denied that Russia has exchanged "butter for guns" and blamed the price rises on "unfriendly" countries.

item.title: 15 stocks â€” including Palantir and Nvidia â€” whose sales estimates have risen the most this earnings season
item.description: Other companies whose consensus 2025 revenue estimates have increased the most include BlackRock and Coterra Energy.

item.title: Warren Buffett speaks out against creating family wealth dynasties, gives away another $1.1 billion
item.description: "I've never wished to create a dynasty or pursue any plan that extended beyond the children," Buffett wrote in a lengthy letter Monday.

item.title: Virgin Atlantic CEO says UK budget is 'tax on growth' with air duties set to rise
item.description: Shai Weiss said that despite aviation's contribution to the economy, "all we've seen is an increase in Air Passenger Duty."

item.title: Cassava Sciencesâ€™ stock craters after Alzheimerâ€™s disease trial fails to meet its goals
item.description: The biotech company said it will discontinue a second trial but will still offer a full analysis of the data.

item.title: Macy's says quarterly sales dropped, delays earnings release after employee hid delivery expenses
item.description: Macy's delayed its results after it discovered an issue related to the reporting of delivery expenses.
